event.title: created by the Colorado legislature on November 1, 1861

data.event: Lake County was one of the original 17 counties created by the Colorado legislature on November 1, 1861.

event.title: was found at Colorado Gulch in 1863

data.event: Placer gold was found at Colorado Gulch in 1863 as part of the Colorado Gold Rush.

event.title: lost territory over the succeeding decades

data.event: Lake County slowly lost territory over the succeeding decades, losing land in its southeast to Saguache County in 1866 and Hinsdale County in 1874; in its southwest to La Plata County in 1874 and San Juan County in 1876, and in its west to Ouray and Gunnison counties in 1877.

event.title: multiple times within just a few years

data.event: With its many reductions in size, Lake County's designated county seat also changed multiple times within just a few years, residing successively in Oro City (from 1861), Lourette (from 1863), Dayton (from 1866), and Granite (from 1868).
